page.title: 13LAUNCH TO ST.MARTINS I.O.S.
page.content: Our launch is called the Gugh and is very important because it is our life-line.It brings all the things we need;gas,oil,groceries,post,livestock the list is endless.The launch also takes things out,such as boxes of flowers,the post,bulbs,cattle and new potatoes.The Gugh used to be an old naval launch,in 1984 it had a refit.It was built in 1944 in Ipswich,it weighs 23.78 metric tonnes without any cargo,and it can carry 10 metric tonnes of cargo.It is about 15 metres long and can carry 49 people including the crew.The Gugh is very tough and can put to sea in nearly all weathers.It usually comes once each weekday but twice on a Thursday to allow shoppers a day on the main island.The service is operated by the Isles of Scilly Steamship Company and links with their ferry to the mainland
